page.title: 08THE BAKERY AT WEST CAMEL.
page.content: The bakery was built in 1903 on the A303, and later a cottage was built next door for the workers. The bakery has not changed much, but the original coke ovens have been changed to oil.They are steam tube ovens and hold 164 loaves.The baker buys his flour in Bristol.It is mostly made from English wheat,but some strong Canadian wheat is bought too The baker starts work at 3.30am to make the bread and cakes he is going to sell that day.On Saturdays he often bakes another batch.There is a shop in the bakery for passing trade,but most of his customers live in surrounding villages and three vans are used for delivery. The baker sells bread,mainly white, but brown is becoming more popular.He also sells cakes.
